title: Dracula first edition cover type
content:
Hello

I know they’ll have been hand-rendered, but does anyone know of a typeface that gets close to this, in particular the descender on the leg of the uppercase ’R’?

[http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/b/ba/Dracula1st.jpeg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024000356/http:/upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/b/ba/Dracula1st.jpeg "http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/b/ba/Dracula1st.jpeg")

thanks

 [‹ (x) National Credit Union Foundation logo serif face - Cremona {Pieter}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024000356/http:/typophile.com/node/38363 "Go to previous forum topic") [Modart magazine logo geometric constructed sans ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024000356/http:/typophile.com/node/38369 "Go to next forum topic")
author: hungrymoon

comments.content: A number of fonts based on the work of Nicolas Jenson have similarly shaped legs on their Rs.
